description.plain:
Born in Asheville, North Carolina, Luke Combs has been a passionate vocalist and musician since a young age, having even performed a solo performance at Carnegie Hall while still in high school. After dabbling in country music during his time at Appalachian State University, he dropped out his senior year to pursue a music career.

In 2014 he released two EPs, The Way She Rides & Can I Get an Outlaw. However, garnered national attention later that year after the release of his first single “Hurricane” selling 15,000 copies within it’s first week.

In October 2016, Combs signed for Columbia Records Nashville. His first studio album This One’s For You was released in June 2017 and reached #1 on Billboard’s Top 200 Country Albums Chart and #5 on Billboard’s Top 200 Albums. This album was re-released with additional unreleased tracks in 2018.

Following this success, in June 2019 he released The Prequel – EP and in the same month was invited to join the prestigious Grand Ole Opry.

songs.full_title: Beautiful Crazy by Luke Combs
songs.title: Beautiful Crazy

description.plain:
“Beautiful Crazy” is a love song about all the different reasons Luke Combs likes a girl. Taste of Country described the song as “a slow, personal love song that truly showcases the singer’s talents.”

The song originally got popular when he posted a video that was shot on his iPhone to Facebook. The video showed him playing the song acoustically and soon gained over 3 million views.

songs.title: Beer Can

description.plain:
On “Beer Can”, Luke Combs submits that drinking beer is the most intriguing way he unwinds after a tiring week. He further implies that apart from giving him the perfect relaxation he needs, there is nothing that gives him more energy or makes him feel happier than his beer cans.
Luke begins the song by detailing his weekly schedule of working a 9-5 job on a minimum wage, with only a few days of vacation. He then goes on to say that his resting days will mostly be spent with a lot of cans of good beer. He wakes up from a possible hangover in the afternoon of the next day, meets up with a new girlfriend, and continues with his drinking till Sunday.

I’ve been working this job 9 – 5
Minimum wage and overtime
But here comes a few days of unpaid vacation

songs.full_title: Beer Never Broke My Heart by Luke Combs
songs.title: Beer Never Broke My Heart

description.plain: “Beer Never Broke My Heart” is about how there aren’t many things in life you can really count on. Beer is on of the few that you can. It won’t break your heart. Unlike women, football teams, and even dogs. Everything has an end to it, but you can always count on a cold one.

songs.full_title: Better Together by Luke Combs
songs.title: Better Together

description.plain:
“Better Together” is a song that Luke Combs specifically wrote as a love letter to his fiancee, Nicole Hocking. Luke Combs and Hocking have been dating for more than three years and got engaged in 2018.

“I wrote that one when me and my fiancee hadn’t even started dating yet. I think there’s definitely gonna be stuff, with us being engaged now, and eventually we’ll be married and have a family,” he muses. “I think there will always be some sort of something like that somewhere in my music.”

songs.full_title: Dear Today by Luke Combs
songs.title: Dear Today

description.plain:
“Dear Today” is a song off of Luke’s 3rd studio album What You See Is What You Get. The song acts as a letter Luke wrote to his future self. The letter reminds him to fix any mistakes he has made with those he loves and to live each moment to the fullest. On July 18, 2019 on Twitter, Luke said about the song,

When I started doing this, I got real busy and started putting things off that I needed to do. This song is to remind myself that I need to do the stuff that is important to me, my friends, my family and my life. It’s a letter from tomorrow to today. It’s called “Dear Today."

Luke first debuted this song before it was officially released at a benefit concert in LA on September 17, 2019.

songs.title: Dive

description.plain: If there’s one thing a good songwriter can do – it’s recognize a great song, regardless of its genre. Luke Combs showed that he has an ear for that particular talent when he chose to cover a song live in concert by pop sensation Ed Sheeran, giving the tune a distinctly country flavor while keeping its bones intact.

songs.full_title: Does To Me by Luke Combs (Ft. Eric Church)
songs.title: Does To Me

description.plain:
In Does To Me, Combs describes his pride for the more mundane, little things his in life that typically wouldn’t be considered large accomplishments. Combs talks about collaborating with Church:

“I think my life has been a series of these kind of things, things that I tried really hard at, but I just wasn’t very good at. I’m still proud that I did them…I think there was something about that idea that [Church] gravitated towards. We’re both from the same part of the country, from the same state, we went to the same school…we have a lot of the same values about music and touring.”

songs.full_title: Even Though I’m Leaving by Luke Combs
songs.title: Even Though I’m Leaving

description.plain:
On the third track of the 2019 EP The Prequel, Luke Combs describes the relationship with his father, and how when they are apart, they are still together in spirit. The song also has an alternative meaning, where it is showcasing how a child relies on their guardians when they are young, but becomes more independent and grown as they become an adult. It also shows that once that guardian has passed, they have left, but haven’t left your side.
A snippet of the song was previewed in a live studio session in an Instagram post on May 30. The video for it released the same day the EP released.

songs.full_title: Fast Car by Luke Combs
songs.title: Fast Car

description.plain:
“Fast Car” is a song by American singer-songwriter Tracy Chapman. Originally, it was released in April 1988 as the lead single from her self-titled debut album.

Now, the cover of this song was done by Luke Combs as because of his ties to it while growing up. His reminiscent cover was released March 24th, 2023 as a part of his album, “Gettin' Old.”

description.plain:
Luke Combs' 2019 smash hit Forever After all is reminiscent of a classic country song. It details into his relationship and even a music video that gives insight into his wedding.
Finally a sense of euphoria splashes over the country star when he finds his forever-girl:

They say nothing lasts forever, but they ain’t seen us together.

songs.full_title: Houston, We Got a Problem by Luke Combs
songs.title: Houston, We Got a Problem

description.plain: Luke Comb’s “Houston We Got a Problem” mainly highlights the beauty and amazing scenery of the State of Texas. Luke lyrically paints a powerful picture of the place as well as its people and lifestyle. He, however, uses the phrase “Houston, We Got a Problem” to depict that although the place has everything he needs, it is not exciting enough if he does not have the person he loves with him.

songs.title: Hurricane

description.plain: Hurricane, which peaked at number 3 on the Billboard Top 100 Country Songs list is a modern ballad about an ex-girlfriend causing harm. Combs has taken time to get over his previous lover, and he is finally ready to go back out. While he is out, the girl shows back up, and he once again falls under the grasp of her beauty.
